Application.name: org.astrogrid/SExtractor

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DetectionImage
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: The image that is used to detect sources. Basic position, shape and size informtaion is derived from this image

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PhotoImage
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: The Image that is used to measure photometric parameters

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: config_file
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: File containing the main configuration parameters for SExtractor

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PARAMETERS_NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: A File containing the list of catalogue paramters that should be computed

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CATALOG_NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: The catalogue of images derived from the input images

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IMAGE_BAND
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: The input image measuerment band. This is used to form the column name in the output VOTable for the measured photometry.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: FILTER_NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: the convolution filter (you can use the standard sextractor filters simply by naming them here)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DETECT_MINAREA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: minimum number of pixels above threshold

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DETECT_THRESH
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: sigmas or threshold,ZP in mag.arcsec-2

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ANALYSIS_THRESH
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: sigmas or threshold,ZP in mag.arcsec-2

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: FILTER
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: apply filter for detection

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DEBLEND_NTHRESH
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Number of deblending sub-thresholds

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DEBLEND_MINCONT
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Minimum contrast parameter for deblending

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CLEAN
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Clean spurious detections? (Y or N)?

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CLEAN_PARAM
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Cleaning Efficiency

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: MASK_TYPE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: type of detection MASKing: can be one of "NONE", "BLANK" or "CORRECT"

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PHOT_APERTURES
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: MAG_APER aperture diameter(s) in pixels

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PHOT_AUTOPARAMS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: MAG_AUTO parameters: <Kron_fact>,>min_radius>

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: MAG_ZEROPOINT
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: magnitude zero-point

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: MAG_GAMMA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: gamma of emulsion (for photographic scans)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: GAIN
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: detector gain in e-/ADU

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PIXEL_SCALE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: size of pixel in arcsec (0=use FITS WCS info)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SEEING_FWHM
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: stellar FWHM in arcsec

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: STARNNW_NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Neural-Network_Weight table filename

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CHECKIMAGE_NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: file containing the checkimage

Application.Description: SExtractor is a program that builds a catalogue of objects from an astronomical image. Although it is particularly oriented towards reduction of large scale galaxy-survey data, it performs rather well on moderately crowded star fields.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: output_catalog

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: maxMatches

CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: maximum number of matches per target

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: COLUMNS

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SPECTRA

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PRIOR

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DZ

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ZMIN

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ZMAX

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: MAG

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ODDS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Odds threshold: affects confidence limits definition

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: INTERP
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Number of interpolated templates between each of the original ones

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: EXCLUDE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Filters to be excluded from the estimation

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: NEW_AB
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: If yes, generate new AB files even if they already exist

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CHECK
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Perform some checks, compare observed colors with templates, etc.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: VERBOSE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Print estimated redshifts to the standard output

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PROBS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Save all the galaxy probability distributions (very large file created)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PROBS_LITE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Save only the final probability distribution

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: GET_Z
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Actually obtain photo-z

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ONLY_TYPE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Use spectroscopic redshifts instead of photo-z

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: MADAU
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Apply Madau correction to spectra

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: Z_THR
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Integrate likelihood for z>z_thr

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: COLOR
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Use colors instead of fluxes

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: PLOTS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: produce plots

Application.Description: The software below implements the Bayesian photometric redshift method described in Benitez 2000 .

Application.Description: SWarp is a program that resamples and co-adds together FITS images using any arbitrary astrometric projection defined in the WCS standard.

Application.name: org.astrogrid/Pegase

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IMF
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: 1: IMF_Kennicutt.dat 2: IMF_Kroupa.dat 3: IMF_MillerScalo.dat 4: IMF_Salpeter.dat 5: IMF_Scalo86.dat 6: IMF_Scalo98.dat 7: lognormal IMF 8: Rana & Basu (1992) 9: Ferrini (1991)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: LMASS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Lower mass

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: UMASS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Upper mass

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SNMODEL
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: model A, B or C of Woosley & Weaver

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: BINFRAC
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Fraction of close binary systems

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: METALICITY
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Metallicity (mass fraction) of the ISM at t=0 (real in [0.,1.])

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: INFALLTIME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Infall timescale (Myr, real)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: INFALLMETAL
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Metallicity of the infalling gas (mass fraction, real in [0.,1.])

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SFSCENARIO
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Type of star formation scenario? -2: file giving the SFR and the metallicity -1: file giving the SFR 0: instantaneous burst 1: SFR=p1 from t=0 to p2 2: SFR=p2*exp(-t/p1)/p1 3: SFR=(Mgas^p1)/p2 10 or more: code of the SFR law you have implemented in "spectra.f"

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: CONEVOL
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Consistent evolution of the stellar metallicity (y/n)?

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SMETAL
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: (real in [0.,1.])

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: FRACSUB
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Mass fraction of substellar objects formed (real in [0.,1.])

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: GALWINDAGE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: Age of the galactic winds (Myr, real)

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: GLOBALEXTINCTION
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: 0: No extinction 1: Extinction for a spheroidal geometry 2: Extinction for a disk geometry: inclination-averaged 3: Extinction for a disk geometry: specific inclination

Application.Description: PEGASE is a code which computes the spectral evolution of galaxies. The evolution of the stars, gas and metals is computed according to user selected star formation laws and initial stellar mass function. The stellar evolutionary tracks extend from the main sequence to the white dwarf stage. The emission of the gas in HII regions is also taken into account. The effect of extinction by dust is also modelled using a radiative transfer code.

Application.name: org.astrogrid/Starburst99

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: NAME
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: any identifier you want to assign to the model. You will find it in the header of each output file.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ISF
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Name: CONTINUOUS STAR FORMATION (>0) OR FIXED MASS (<=0)
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: if this is a negative integer, star formation is instantaneous, otherwise it is continuous.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TOMA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Name: TOTAL STELLAR MASS [10^6 SOLAR MASSES] IF 'FIXED MASS' IS CHOSEN
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: this is the total stellar mass (spread out between the upper and lower cut-off masses). It is only used if an instantaneous burst is specified.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SFR
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Name: SFR [SOLAR MASSES PER YEAR] IF 'CONT. SF' IS CHOSEN:
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: the star formation rate (only used for a continuous rate). The total accumulated mass is spread out between the upper and lower cut-off masses.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ALPHA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: IMF exponent. A power law is assumed.(2.35 = SALPETER):

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: UPMA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: upper mass limit for the IMF.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: DOMA
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: lower mass limit for the IMF.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: SNCUT
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: stars with ZAMS masses of 8 M and higher form supernovae. This is the suggested standard value but can be modified if desired.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: BHCUT
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: stars with ZAMS masses of 120 M and lower form supernovae. An alternative scenario would be to let stars above a certain threshold form a black hole. For instance, BHCUT=40. results in SNe only from the mass range 40 to 8 M.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IZ
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: 92-94 STD. MASS-LOSS: 11=0.001; 12=0.004; 13=0.008; 14=0.020; 15=0.040 92-94 HIGH MASS-LOSS: 21=0.001; 22=0.004; 23=0.008; 24=0.020; 25=0.040 24 -- this integer indicates the evolutionary tracks to be used. The choices are 11-15 or 21-25, where the former select one of five metallicities with the standard tracks, and the latter do the same for the high mass-loss tracks. Example: "23" selects 40% solar metallicity with the high mass loss tracks.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IWIND
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: (0=MAEDER; 1=EMP.; 2=THEOR.; 3=ELSON; 4=UCL): [IWIND] 2 -- this selects the wind model to be used for the calculation of the wind power. The four models are discussed in ApJ, 401, 498 (1992) and in Smith et al. (2002). "2" is the suggested default parameter.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TIME1
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: [1.E6 YEARS] the epoch of the onset of the star formation. In almost all cases you want this to be close to 0. It should not be exactly 0 for numerical reasons. 0.01 (i.e. 10e4 yr) is a good number.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: STEP
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: [1.e6 years] this is the timestep used for the calculations. It is a very important parameter. On the one hand, the computing time scales with STEP, so you want to avoid too high resolution, but on the other, short evolutionary phases can be missed. 0.1 (i.e. 10e5 yr) is a good value if you use full isochrone synthesis. If full isochrone synthesis is not used, 0.1 or larger is suggested only for tests --- be aware that WR or RSG numbers are no longer properly calculated for a STEP of 0.1 unless full isochrone synthesis is selected!

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TMAX
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: [1.e6 YEARS]: the oldest age of the model.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: JMG
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Name: SMALL (=0) OR LARGE (=1) MASS GRID; ISOCHRONE ON LARGE GRID (=2) OR FULL ISOCHRONE (=3):
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: these are four options for the interpolation in mass. They are explained in the code. Shortly: 0 -- evolutionary synthesis with a mass resolution of 5 M (only recommended for tests); 1 -- same as 0, but with a resolution of 1 M. This method was used in Leitherer & Heckman (1995); 2 -- isochrone synthesis with a fixed mass resolution of 1 M; 3 -- isochrone synthesis with a variable mass grid. This is the fanciest method and is the recommended mode.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: LMIN
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: LMIN and LMAX are the indices of the evolutionary tracks, sorted by mass. Normally you do not want to mess with the variable and leave it at 0. However, if you want to track down some peculiarity of the output, you may want to compute the parameters for only one track. For instance, specifying 21,21 indicates that only a 100 M star should by used, and everything else is suppressed. The cross-ID's between index and mass are at the bottom of the input file. The example here refers to JMG=1 or 2. For JMG=0, you would have chosen 5,5. This does not apply to JMG=3 since the mass grid is variable and LMIN, LMAX are not used.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: LMAX
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: LMIN and LMAX are the indices of the evolutionary tracks, sorted by mass. Normally you do not want to mess with the variable and leave it at 0. However, if you want to track down some peculiarity of the output, you may want to compute the parameters for only one track. For instance, specifying 21,21 indicates that only a 100 M star should by used, and everything else is suppressed. The cross-ID's between index and mass are at the bottom of the input file. The example here refers to JMG=1 or 2. For JMG=0, you would have chosen 5,5. This does not apply to JMG=3 since the mass grid is variable and LMIN, LMAX are not used.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: TDEL
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: [1.e6YR] the file containing the output spectrum can be pretty big. This parameter controls the time step to print out the spectrum. This is independent of the time resolution -- only the print out is affected! 1 Myr is usually a good value but if you compute the starburst up to 100 Myr, you may prefer TDEL=5 Myr unless you have many Gb of disk space.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IATMOS
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: 1=PLA,2=LEJ,3=LEJ+SCH,4=LEJ+HIL,5=PAU+HIL [IATMOS] 5 -- this is the choice of the model atmosphere. 1 is a bare-bone version with black bodies, good only for tests. 2 uses the Kurucz models as compiled by Lejeune for all stars. 3 uses Lejeune for stars with plane-parallel atmospheres and Schmutz for stars with strong winds. 4 uses Lejeune, but replaces the Schmutz by the Hillier atmospheres. 5 is like 4, except for the O atmospheres, for which we use the Pauldrach models. 5 is the recommended value.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: ILINE
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Name: METALLICITY OF THE UV LINE SPECTRUM:
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: 1=SOLAR, 2=LMC/SMC) [ILINE] 1 -- a switch for the choice of the UV spectral library. This switch applies to both the FUSE and the HST/IUE libraries. It is independent of the metallicity of the tracks/atmospheres. Normally one would use ILINE=1 with IZ=24 and ILINE=2 with IZ=22.

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IVT
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: atmospheric parameters used for the spectral features in the near-IR. Detailed explanations are in the sp-feature subroutine. Defaults are 3,0, i.e. microturbulent velocities of 3 km/sec and solar abundance ratios for alpha-element/Fe

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: IRSG
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: atmospheric parameters used for the spectral features in the near-IR. Detailed explanations are in the sp-feature subroutine. Defaults are 3,0, i.e. microturbulent velocities of 3 km/sec and solar abundance ratios for alpha-element/Fe

CmdLineParameterDefn.name: output
CmdLineParameterDefn.agpd:UI_Description: output file
